Description: Fragment of upper part of black figure painted pottery situla. Bird facing right.
Curator's comments: Possibly from the same pot as Pl. GB 604, 13 (BM GR 1888.2-8.14). Other scaly birds appear on Pls. GB 602, 5 and 604, 9, and a scaly sphinx on Pl. GB 602, 2. Similar scales occur sporadically in earlier East Greek and Cycladic vase-painting, e.g. on the eagle of a fragment of a plate of Middle to Late Wild Goat Style (Delphi 2633?), on sirens and sphinxes of Chiot Chalice style (GR 1924.12-1.126, 127, 150), on the birds of the East Greek fragments of Pl. GB 588, 1-2, on the sirens of a 'Melian' amphora in Mykonos (AM lvii, Beilage 31).
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 604, 15 (and Pl. GB 597, 3)) (Group C19)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 259)
